result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Fred Ray Kelly

records.addlTxt: Routed to Judge's JA & CC's JA
records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
11:24 AM Defendant Fred Ray Kelly in court from Jackson Correctional Inst, via telephone.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Defendant makes statement. Prompt disposition filed Def. wants an attorney and wants to wait for P.D. State heard on prompt disposition. Court question def. on court appointed form.  Def. is waiting to get notarized.  Court questions def. on prompt disposition. Court will deal with issues on final pre-trial. Def. would like have a preliminary hearing. Def. heard on issues he is having. Court advise def. to file an complaint on party that he is having issues with. Def. heard on preliminary hearing with CC. Court explains. 
Note court never called on record.
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report - 2nd or Subsequent Attorney
Notice of Hearing  -Kelly
Final pre-trial on November 28, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on October 17, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Notice of Hearing

3:15 PM/Room 203. Defendant Fred Ray Kelly appeared by video, in custody at Jackson Correctional.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin. All appearances are by Zoom. Court reviews reason for today's hearing. Def. was represented at one time, attny withdrew. State gives further background, Def. has filed request for prompt disposition, requests Court to clarify if Def. still is requesting such and if he wants to go forward with or without counsel. Response by Def. Response by State. Court advises Def. of his right to attorney but indicates does not have control of public defender appointment of counsel, explains time constraints required by request for prompt disposition. Court gives options: waive attny rights or wait until PD assigns attny. Def. asks Court to appoint attorney. Court indicates only Judge can appoint attorney. Further discussion. Court orders COC to send Def. an application for court appointed attorney. State asks that jury trial be set for December 14, 2022. Def. not waiving right to attorney and not waiving request for speedy trial. Court will schedule a STC/hearing for waiver of attny before Judge Rhode. Jury trial set for Dec. 14. STC  set before Judge Rhode for 10-17-22 at 11 a.m. Court orders Def. to return application for court-appointed attorney prior to next hearing.  Final pre-trial Nov. 28.
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report - 2nd or Subsequent Attorney
Writ of Habeas Corpus
for Withdrawal
Status conference on October 5, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
Writ of Habeas Corpus Ad Prosequendum  and Order to Institution
to Withdraw
and Certificate of Appearance

2:58 PM Defendant Fred Ray Kelly appeared by telephone, in custody from Jackson Correctional Inst..  Attorney Christopher Restameyer, special appearance in court for Fred Ray Kelly.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin. All parties via zoom. Atty Restameyer has copy of complaint, waives reading, bond set and will continue. State notes date for P.H. Def. would like to speak. Court advise def. that he is represented.  Def. wants speedy prompt disposition. State follow statute regarding prompt disposition. State will set sooner if waiver of p.h. Prompt disposition was received 9-7-22 from DA. Def. continues. Court adjourns.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
Preliminary hearing on September 14, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
1:39 PM Defendant Fred Ray Kelly appeared via phone, in custody, from Dodge Correction Inst.  Attorney Kelly Hays in court for State of Wisconsin. Court reviews report from Status of Counsel. Def. wishes to want an atty.  Court heard on Nhia Lee Standards and finds good cause.  Def. heard on court appointed atty. Def. heard on constitutional rights. Def. is getting transferred to Jackson Correctional Inst. Court will find good cause and appoint atty, State objects.  Court advise def. that will not appointed atty.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report
Bail/Bond - Refused to Sign

1:44 PM Defendant Fred Ray Kelly appeared by video, in custody from Dodge Correctional Inst.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin.  All parties via zoom. Court reviews Status of Counsel.  Def. wants court to appoint attorney.  Def. wants P.H. and speedy trial. CC is going to allow PD to try to get atty appointed. Court finds good cause.  Def. heard on P.H. rights and put a stop on evidence. Def. wants an attorney.  Court will allow PD one more chance to find an atty.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report
Bail/Bond mailed to Dodge Correctional Inst.

1:09 PM Defendant Fred Ray Kelly appeared by video, in custody from Dodge Correctional Inst.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin. All parties via zoom.  Counsel report filed. Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given atty rights and given 3 options, PD, hire own or court appointed atty. Def. would like atty appointed in timely and request p.h. in timely matter. State gives bail bond recommendation and explain why set for today. Def. heard on bond.  Court orders $25,000 signature bond.  Court reviews report from P.D. Court notes counsel has not be appointed. Court heard on preliminary hearing without counsel and finds good cause to go past time limits for p.h. Court notes def. is in custody.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report
